fields.description:
h3. Summary
The Status Macro does not work when linking a relative page, but it works when adding a Web link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Status Macro item
# Select the created macro
# Use the Insert Link in the toolbar
# Use either _Search_ or _Recently Viewed_ items to add a link
# Save page
# Macro vanishes

h3. Expected Results
The Status Macro has a link to the selected page.

h3. Actual Results
The Status Macro vanishes from the page.

h3.Workaround
Use _Weblink_ item to add an absolute link to the target item, macro will stay in the interface when saved.
fields.summary: Relative Links Causes Status Macro to Vanish

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33830].
  {panel}

The generation of the macro body hash is not working correctly.  It happens in two spots:

1) In the MacroModuleContextExtractorImpl ([Connect Source|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/AC/repos/atlassian-connect/browse/plugin/src/main/java/com/atlassian/plugin/connect/plugin/capabilities/module/MacroModuleContextExtractorImpl.java#47]).  This call happens during the execution of a dynamic content connect macro.  Despite the source calling the variable {{storageFormatBody}}, its actually the view format.  *This calculation is wrong, it should be using the storage format.*  This class is a normal p2 macro which runs inside Confluence and is responsible for doing things like render the html with the iframe.
2) In the ContentMacroServiceImpl ([Confluence Source|https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/api/impl/service/content/ContentMacroServiceImpl.java#113]).  *This calculation is correct, its based on the macro body in storage format.*  This call happens (eventually) after the call to the REST api to collect the body.

*Problem: Inside a normal execution of a macro, there is no (obvious?) way to collect the macro body in storage format so there is no obvious way for the connect macro to calculate the macro hash correctly.*

Ideal solution:
Rendering engine calculates the hash and passes it to each macro execution through the RenderContext.  This moves the entire calculation of the hash to the Confluence source code and makes sure its the same.

Interim solution:
Work out how a normal p2 plugin can access the macro body in storage format so it can calculate the hash correctly.
fields.summary: T26 Generation of Macro Body Hash

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33828].
  {panel}

For generating links to page sections the TOC macro will currently always use the normalized text of a headline.

I propose that, if the headline paragraph contains or is directly followed by an anchor macro, this anchor name should be used by the TOC macro instead.

This has two advantages:
a) Generated anchor names by Confluence can be quite silly, if the title is long or contains non-latin glyphs or even characters like ", / (or in my case: all of that).
b) Titles tend to change, while the manual anchors will likely be more persistent. Therefore if the TOC macro would use those a user could calmly C&P links from the TOC.
fields.summary: TOC macro should use manual anchor if present

When using Mentions feature, the display of mentioned user is not consistent in two states:
# Page is previewed before save (or in Page Editor)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33804].
  {panel}

When the a page is favourited by the user, a label favourite will be created and associated with the page in the database identify with namespace *my* and the owner userkey  in the label table. Please note, this label is not visible in the actual page.

|| labelid  |  name   |           owner              | namespace  ||
|| 21954561  |  favourite  |  2c986a1a412f9cb201412f9d12bb003e |  my ||

When a actual favourite label is created in the page,  the label does not have a owner and it is identified as global in the namespace.

|| labelid  |  name   |           owner              | namespace  ||
|| 21954561  |  favourite  |  2c986a1a412f9cb201412f9d12bb003e |  my ||
|| 1015817  |  favourite  |   |  global ||


However, when you search by label in the Confluence either using Confluence search or contentbylabel macro, both the user favourite page and the pages with the actual 'favourite label' will be listed in the result.

This can prove to be confusing and misleading.

A possible solution to this issue is to search Confluence label under the namespace 'global' only.
fields.summary: Confluence search should not list user favourited page when search by label.

fields.description:
Our Confluence install grinds to a halt on average about nce every 3 days (it's fairly sporadic though).  There doesn't seem to be anthing in the logs apart from a lot of warnings about Confluence's communications with our Jira install.

It seems that when this happens, our database connections either skyrocket, or stop closing, and after examining the connections it seems that the 'confluence' user is often the one topping out.  We have a few other database users that we use for our own Confluence plugins but their connection levels seem to stay fairly calm.

This has all happened since we upgraded from 4.3.7 to 5.4.2, obviously this change broguht with it a massive increase in the amount of AJAX calls bouncing around, and on top of that we are using an RSS feeds plugin that adds to that number.  

With this is mind we increased the TCP acceptCount value (found in server.xml), from 10 to 1024.  We had a similar issue in our instance of Jira and this change fixed that.  Unfortunately Confluence has continued to crash for us.

Any advice would be greatly appreciated.


Matt
fields.summary: Confluence crashing regularly, seemingly not dropping database connections

fields.description:
It seems that the links to confluence attachments are not permalinks (stabe links). 

Example:

https://example.com/download/attachments/116065791/file.pdf?version=1&modificationDate=1361208962871&api=v2

Instead they should be like

https://example.com/download/attachments/116065791/file.pdf

And obviously, uploading a new version of an attachment should not change its permalink.

That's an essential feature for any HTML application. By not conforming with this Confluence is breaking HTTP standards and making indexing and search much harder.

Also, the same design flaw does break lots of links from other web applications (when the attachment is updated).
fields.summary: provide permalinks to confluence attachments

fields.description:
h3. Background:
You have mentioned someone in a page, now if you move the page to other page/space, you'll receive an email saying that you were assign to this "new" page/space.

h3. Steps to reproduce:

Create a dummy user with a valid email, then mention this dummy user in a page. Now check if the workbox was updated and if there's an email there. (Expected behavior).

If yes, then move this page that you created mentioning this to other space/page. Login with his credentials and see if the workbox is mentioning the user and check if you got another email.

h3. Workaround:
There's no workaround.
h3. Impact:
If you're moving around 100 pages, is 100 emails that will be sent.

fields.description:
{code}Error rendering macro 'junitreport' : com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: URI scheme is not "file"{code}
The above error is displayed when using {{http://host/path/}} for JUnit Report's Directory (URL) of the test result file.

Note: The example in the documentation shows that JUnit Report Macro is supposed to work with test results file located in network drive.

*Steps to replicate*
# Download the sample attachment [^junitexample.zip], extract and put it in a network drive location (e.g.: 'storagekl2')
# Create a new Confluence page
# Insert JUnit Report Macro
# Edit the macro
# In 'Directory (URL) of your test result files' field, enter {{http://storagekl2/junitexample}}
# Refresh the preview
# Message shown {{Error rendering macro 'junitreport' : com.atlassian.renderer.v2.macro.MacroException: URI scheme is not "file"}}
fields.summary: JUnit Report Macro Error when Including Test Result from Network Drive

fields.description:
After upgrading from 5.4.3 to 5.5.2 I found some error messages in catalina.out:
"SEVERE: The web application [] appears to have started a thread named [com.mchange.v2.async.ThreadPoolAsynchronousRunner$PoolThread-#0] but has failed to stop it. This is very likely to create a memory leak."
fields.summary: Severe errors in catalina.out after upgrade to 5.5.2

fields.description:
Unfortunately, users are allowed to align any sort of macros to the right and are disappointed / frustrated that the macro content doesn't align correct after save. Reproduce: * create a 2 / 3 column layout * add some text * align it to the right with text-tools * add, e.g. the {children} macro or any other macro that renders as a block element The expectation: * children macro aligns right to the column / page The Bug: * Block element macro is saved within {{

}} which is not correct! * browsers doesn't render the block aligned to the right > correct, but doens't match the expectation
fields.summary: Right alignment allows block element alignment in editor which wont't work

fields.description:
Hello,

if I expand the breadcrumbs on a restricted page, the restrictions icon (a red lock) disappears, see attachments.

Kind regards,
Frank.
fields.summary: Restrictions icon disappears when expanding breadcrumbs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33783].
  {panel}

Users are unable to link Confluence pages to JIRA issues:

# Open a JIRA issue.
# Click 'More' > 'Link'.
# Select 'Confluence Page' in the left menu.
# Click *'search for a page'* under the Page URL field.
# Make sure that the 'Server' field is displaying the correct Confluence application.
# All search results for ANY Confluence page come up empty.

In addition to that, when accessing JIRA issues that are linked with Confluence pages, users should be able to see the name of the page under the *Issue Links* section:

!issue_links_correct.png!

A few days ago this behaviour seems to have changed and now users are intermittently getting an "You do not have permission to view this page" message instead of the name of the page:

!issue_links_broken.png!

(!) Clicking on the link still takes the user to the page, as expected.

Currently there are no workarounds to this situation.
fields.summary: User can't link Confluence pages to JIRA issues and gets a "You do not have permission to view this page" for Confluence pages in Issue Links

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33777].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to Reproduce:

# Setup Confluence with Microsoft SQL Server, PostGreSQL or MySQL
# Create a space
# Create a page
# Add restriction into the page you just created
# Export this space
# Import the exported space into Confluence instance that use Microsoft SQL Server as its database

h3. Expected Results:

Confluence should be able to import this space as it could with Confluence that use PostGreSQL or MySQL database.

h3. Actual Results:

Confluence with MS SQL server will failed to process the space import with the following stack traces:

{code}Caused by: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Error while importing backup: Hibernate operation: could not insert: [com.atlassian.confluence.security.ContentPermission#8323117]; SQL []; Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).
org.springframework.dao.DataIntegrityViolationException: Hibernate operation: could not insert: [com.atlassian.confluence.security.ContentPermission#8323117]; SQL []; Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).; nested exception is java.sql.SQLException: Violation of UNIQUE KEY constraint 'cp_unique_user_groups'. Cannot insert duplicate key in object 'dbo.CONTENT_PERM'. The duplicate key value is (8257543, View, <NULL>, <NULL>).
	at com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.xmlimport.parser.BackupParser.endElement(BackupParser.java:53){code}

h3. Workaround 1

Remove all page restrictions from the source Confluence before generating the space export. Then re-add the restrictions in the target instance after the import

h3. Workaround 2

# Drop the constraint in the target instance:
{code}
ALTER TABLE CONTENT_PERM DROP CONSTRAINT cp_unique_user_groups;
{code}
# Restore the Space
# Re-add the constraint:
{code}
ALTER TABLE CONTENT_PERM ADD CONSTRAINT [cp_unique_user_groups] UNIQUE NONCLUSTERED 
(
	[CPS_ID] ASC,
	[CP_TYPE] ASC,
	[USERNAME] ASC,
	[GROUPNAME] ASC
);
{code}

h3. Workaround 3

[Migrate your Confluence database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+to+Another+Database] server to other [supported database|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Supported+Platforms].
fields.summary: Space Export Containing Page Restriction Fails during import into Confluence with SQL Server
Start Confluence in Safe Mode

fields.description:
As part of CONFDEV-24710, a change was made on the 5.5-stable branch that fundamentally changed the way that some of the application code interacts with the {{TransactionalCacheFactory}}. This was done under the banner of cluster cache optimisation, but it in effect it completely bypasses the transactional semantics of the caches in question.

The most noticeable effect of this is a recurrence of the "user already exists" and "directory removed during iteration" errors that used to plague the builds before they were fixed by the introduction of transactional caches.

While this change did go into stable, at this point we do not believe that it is likely to have a noticeable impact on production systems. If it does, it'll most likely have similar impacts to the test failure messages mentioned above, where caches related to users or user directories go stale.

However, we should be alive to the possibility that customers will report issues along these lines (cc [~shaffenden]).

For now, we'll get this fixed ASAP on stable and get it merged to master toot sweet. This should go into Thunder26 and 5.5.3.
fields.summary: Transactional caches are being bypassed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33769].
  {panel}

We notice that a lot of our customer have troubles upgrading Confluence when their collation (MSSQL) or charter encoding /Colation/Engine (mysql).

Because of that they end up creating support cases to address this miss behaviours during the upgrade.

We indeed added a collation checker for both MySQL and MSSQL but what we would like is to add that check in the initial setup as well, so we will get new users unable to setup Confluence due the above error (L3/L4) instead of clients with odd errors or production outages due the wrong collation in an failed upgrade attempt (L1/L2).

Fix those settings is stressful to our customers since they only find this out months after installing Confluence (during an upgrade) and most of them do not have an allocated DBA  to address these problems.

h4. Work Around:

In case you already have a Confluence installed check the set of steps on below KB to fix the database inconsistencies:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+fix+the+collation+and+character+set+of+a+Microsoft+SQL+Server+database
fields.summary: Add a database collation checker on the initial setup.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33763].
  {panel}

Symptoms:
  * If image is embedded into file then it won't be displayed.
  * Scanned PDF document (which is effectively consists of single embedded image) won't be displayed at all.
  * There is next log statement in logs: *WARN [DefaultSlideCacheManager:thread-1] [com.benryan.conversion.MemoryAwarePDFRenderer] drawImage Image of size 2464*3448 px dropped for memory protection*

Reason:
  * Image rendering takes considerable amount of memory and makes some OD instances crash.
  * Temporary workaround applied on confluence side is to have image rendering disabled if image is large. 


*OD workaround*:
  At the moment there is no workaround for OD (OnDemand) customers except scan documents into JPEG format instead of pdf. We're are plan to roll out on better memory calculation algorithm and better handling of concurrent macro rendering however there is no ETA.

*BTF workaround*:
  For BTF (Behind The Firewall) admins could start confluence with -Dpdf.render.memory.guard.disabled=true property in order to disable memory guard. That will make all pdfs to be rendered.
(!) Note: Disabling this memory guard can cause [OutOfMemoryErrors|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/How+to+Fix+Out+of+Memory+Errors+by+Increasing+Available+Memory] if a high resolution image is embedded in a PDF. 


*EDIT 21/04/2015*
  Current pdf macro is deprecated and replaced by `Files and Images` (available from toolbar). More details are onto https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/Displaying+Files+and+Images

*Update 23/11/2015* 
  Condition was reversed. You won't need to put system property and by default images size within pdf is not limited for BTF installations.
fields.summary: Large embedded images are not displayed within pdf macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33761].
  {panel}

The view trash page currently only has:
Page name (non linked) and Restore | Purge links.

I feel that (sortable/filterable) fields could include:

Page name (linked with page URL), Deleted by (user), Deleted (date/time), Attachments (link to page attachments) as well as the Restore | Purge

Page history should include whether something has been restored from the trash as a page revision.
fields.summary: The Space Admin > View Trash page should have more fields for deleted items so an admin can more easily view what has been deleted by space users.
Support @values for the space parameter in Content Report Table macro (eg. @self etc...)

fields.description:
h5. Overview
The Issue Link is not updated when the one of the original macros were removed from the page and throwing some error message on the Confluence UI

h5. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a Blank Page from a brand new Confluence installation
!jira_issue_1.JPG|thumbnail!

* Insert two JIRA Issues Macro as per the following screen shot
!jira_issue_2.JPG|thumbnail!

* Confirm on the amount of JIRA links (In this case 2 links)
!jira_issue_3.JPG|thumbnail!

* After that, we edited the page and removed one of links. After saving the page, the links were still showing 2 links and after clicking the links button, we get the following error on the UI (and the links is showing 0 JIRA Links)
!jira_issue_4.JPG|thumbnail!

* After refreshing the page, it will show the wrong Issue Link count again (2 Issue Link) in this example
!jira_issue_5.JPG|thumbnail!

Checking from the {{atlassian-confluence.log}}, we can see the following exception below:
{code}
2014-05-24 20:30:17,059 WARN [http-bio-8551-exec-6] [metadata.jira.helper.JiraMetadataErrorHelper] printError One or more JIRA instances could not be reached.
 -- url: /conf_551/rest/jira-metadata/1.0/metadata | userName: admin | referer: http://localhost:8551/conf_551/display/ds/JIRA+Issues+Macro+Testing
java.util.concurrent.CancellationException
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerGet(FutureTask.java:220)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.get(FutureTask.java:83)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.metadata.jira.service.helper.FutureMetadataHelper.processFutures(FutureMetadataHelper.java:58)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.metadata.jira.service.helper.FutureMetadataHelper.process(FutureMetadataHelper.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.metadata.jira.service.JiraMetadataService.getMetadata(JiraMetadataService.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.metadata.jira.rest.JiraMetadataResource.getMetadata(JiraMetadataResource.java:25)
...
{code}

h5. Expected Behaviour
The Issue Link count should reflect the updated amount of JIRA Issues Macro link after the page is updated (when any JIRA Issues Macro is / are removed)

h5. Environment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33751].
  {panel}

The time it takes to load the hierarchy and then actually scroll to locate the items to select is significant and challenging to select the correct ones when a space contains hundreds if not thousand(s) of pages (e.g. our knowledgebase). 

When a user selects a custom export, please do not auto select everything and auto expand the entire hierarchy.  Allow a user to navigate the tree just like they would when in Confluence.  Expand where needed - they may just need to select a few parent pages - or, if they need child pages, they are more apt to easily locate and select the correct ones when navigating the tree as they would in the UI. 

It should also take significant less time if you are not loading the entire tree - load only until selected. 

We use the space export often to print topics, chapters, guides since there is: 
1) No method to print a selected page tree
2) The page export doesn't include the header page, copyright statement pages, toc, etc.
fields.summary: Do not auto expand selected when doing a custom space export

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33748].
  {panel}

We are planning to use the new Knowledge Base space, and are very happy that Confluence now features such an easy way to build a KB.

We need to have a KB in more than just English. For now that means French, and maybe other languages later on.

This means that we need to get the How-To and Troubleshooting templates translated. What I did first was un-promoting the original templates, and creating new templates based on what the original ones contained (ctrl-A, ctrl-C, ctrl-V), then promoting those custom templates. Works great!

Sadly, that means that the Page Template Wizard does not act the same at all with the "copied" templates: 
* Instead of a modal window with the Title and Labels fields to fill, I get a full-page with two small fields for the $descriptionHtml and $contentbylabelMacro variables
* Instead of a page pre-filled with the correct title and the correct Content-by-label Macro setting, I get the text from the variables as-is, within the content.

Reading the documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+a+Template), I understand that this is the way variables are supposed to work for now. But I find it odd that the default templates would benefit from a pretty modal window and pre-filled sections, when custom templates have to fallback on something less ideal.

In the end, instead of un-promoting the default templates and promoting my own translated templates, I simply translated the default templates (save for the template title, which apparently cannot be changed).

Still, I do hope Atlassian is planning on pushing this Template Wizard feature further. This would be of tremendous help for KB administrators.

Thank you for reading.
fields.summary: Knowledge Base: custom templates cannot yet fully use the Page Template Wizard

fields.description:
This manager provides a service to track {{ImageDetails}} for image attachments.  When requesting an {{ImageDetails}} object for an attachment it will create on if it does not exist.

The {{ThumbnailManager}} uses this service to provide thumbnails for image attachments.  This is the flow:

# {{DefaultThumbnailManager.getThumbnailInfo}} is called to get the thumbnail for an attachment
# This calls {{DefaultImageDetailsManager.getImageDetails}} to see if there is a stored {{ImageDetails}} object for the attachment
# If there is none available {{DefaultImageDetailsManager.createImageDetails}} is called to create one, which is then stored.

The problem is {{DefaultImageDetailsManager}} does not define what transactions are required.  So if you call this method in a READ_ONLY transaction and there is no {{ImageDetails}} available for the attachment, then you get an exception like this:

{noformat}
org.springframework.dao.InvalidDataAccessApiUsageException: Write operations are not allowed in read-only mode (FlushMode.NEVER): Turn your Session into FlushMode.AUTO or remove 'readOnly' marker from transaction definition. at org.springframework.orm.hibernate.HibernateTemplate.checkWriteOperationAllowed(HibernateTemplate.java:1000)
    ...
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.DefaultImageDetailsDao.save(DefaultImageDetailsDao.java:23)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pInvalidDataAccessApiUsageExceptionages.attachments.DefaultImageDetailsManager.storeImageDetails(DefaultImageDetailsManager.java:69)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.DefaultImageDetailsManager.createImageDetails(DefaultImageDetailsManager.java:61)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.attachments.DefaultImageDetailsManager.getImageDetails(DefaultImageDetailsManager.java:49)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.getThumbnailInfo(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:128)
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.thumbnail.DefaultThumbnailManager.getThumbnailInfo(DefaultThumbnailManager.java:122)
{noformat}
fields.summary: No transactions defined on DefaultImageDetailsManager

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-33725].
  {panel}

Sometimes there are discussion threads within a page that I would like to show to another user not in or authorized for that specific page.  The Share button at the top of the space is great.  However I suggest we add a "Share" option within a comment (Reply, Edit, Delete, Like, Share).  

Resolution option 1
If selected at the comment level, that specific comment only should be emailed to the "new" recipient.  If the new recipient is not an authorized user of that space from which the Share button was activated, the recipient should only get a "Reply" option in the mail.  

Resolution option 2 - best resolution
If selected at the comment level, that specific comment THREAD - not just that one comment -  should be emailed to the "new" recipient.  If the new recipient is not an authorized user of that space from which the Share button was activated, the recipient should only get a "Reply" option in the mail.   I define a THREAD as when i use the shortcut "M" within a space to start a comment, and others reply to that original comment.


*Reporter*: Susan Lawrence
*E-mail*: [mailto:susanl@synnex.com]
fields.summary: Share comments/comment thread

fields.description:
When you share a page with a group, Confluence will send an email to all group members, including group members that were disabled. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add two users to the internal directory
# Create a group and add both users
# Share a page with the group. All group members receive an email.
# Disable one of the group members
# Share another page with the group. The expected result is that only active users will receive the email. In actuality, all group members receive an email as before, despite one of the users being disabled.

# Create a custom field in JIRA.
# [Translate custom field|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+a+Custom+Field#ConfiguringaCustomField-Translatingacustomfield] into another language (language B)
# Change JIRA language to language B
# Ensure Confluence is in language A. 
# Insert JIRA issues macro and adjust display options to ensure it will include custom field.
# Custom field will display in language B, the other fields in language A, matching Confluence's profile language.
# Change JIRA back to language A. 
# Check Confluence, custom field is still in language B.
# Edit page, re-insert JIRA issues macro, and language will now be in language A.
# Change Confluence to language B, custom field is still in language A
# The Jira filters macro does not load the value from the custom field.


Tested in English/Japanese, and it's reported also in English/German
